medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started suddenly at midnight and is more intense but has the same character as the pain experienced with the ulcer. The patient had more fatty foods yesterday than usual. The pain radiates to her back and is associated with nausea but no emesis. She denies fevers or chills, chest pain, cough, and dysuria. She has had intentional weight loss over several months but is unsure of the amount.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic back pain, treated for H. pylori infection one month ago.
medical_history.family_history: No history of ulcer disease or gallbladder disease. Mother has a family history of hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and breast cancer.
